intro: Platyschkuhria integrifolia var. desertorum, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant has lance-shaped, waxy leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy seeds dispersed by the wind. This resilient species is adapted to harsh desert conditions, making it an important part of the local flora.
